intro: Calorhabdos sutchuenensis, commonly known as the Sichuan fireplant, is a unique flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its striking red and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils at elevations above 2,000 meters. Its foliage consists of finely divided leaves that are aromatic and often used in traditional Chinese medicine. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
